passages.text: Technology | Semiconductors and Semiconductor Equipment
Links to Related Research
Notes from Day 1 of 2025 Evercore ISI Semis Conference Notes from Day 2 of 2025 Evercore ISI Semis Conference

SCE companies were generally confident on strength in leading- edge spend across F&L and memory markets but flagged China as the key wild card. We found the discussions with LRCX, NVMI and TER particularly upbeat - 1) LRCX noted healthy visibility into 1H26, and expressed confidence in NAND and GAA w/ shift to Moly, 2) NVMI highlighted product cycles helping conviction on growth in 2026 and 3) TER highlighted market share gain opportunities in Compute test:

AMAT - China is expected to digest after heavy 2023- 24 spending, with normalized exposure at \(\sim 20 - 25\%\) and growing local competition. Looking ahead, DRAM (ex- China) growing \(50\%\) YY, NAND remains a modest contributor, and in leading- edge logic AMAT sees its TAM expanding from \(\) 12B\(\) (FinFET) to \(\) 14B\(\) (GAA + BSP) with share rising above \(50\%\) .

ASML Mgmt. noted increasing uncertainty going in 2026 as AI demand continues to remain strong vs. weaker cycle spend. Mgmt. expects litho intensity to continue growing as DRAM customers increase EUV exposures and F&L customers return to shirking post GAA/BSD ramps.

LRCX - Mgmt. didn't provide a formal outlook for 2026 but expects strength in leading- edge F&L and Adv Packaging, with LRCX positioned to outgrow WFE on higher deposition and etch intensity from 3D scaling. China remains volatile, with \(\sim 20\%\) normalized exposure, while NAND benefits from higher- layer count upgrades driving mid- teens bit growth.

CAMT - Though visibility into 2026 remains limited given short 3- 6- month lead times on advanced packaging tools, Mgmt. sees HBM as a multi- year growth driver fueled by higher capacity per accelerator, taller stacks, larger die sizes, and denser interconnects. CAMT is well- positioned to capture this opportunity leveraging its next gen Eagle G5 and Hawk tools.

FORM - Mgmt. highlighted GM recovery as #1 priority and highlighted that the company is undertaking initiatives to drive operating cost reductions which could drive GM to \(45\%\) on similar revenue levels. On the top- line FORM expects to see strength in HBM with HBM4 ramps in 2H25 coupled with CPO tailwinds and qualification for AI GPUs.

NVMI - Mgmt. doesn't expect a digestion in China revs. GAA ramps expected to remain on track to achieving \(\) 500\mathrm{mn}$ by 2026. Product cycles helping conviction on growth in 2026 with growing adoption of material metrology tools in across leading- edge memory and foundry customers.

ONTO - Mgmt. highlighted new growth vectors in advanced packaging with adoption of wafer- level multi- chip modules (WMCM) for smartphones (revenue impact beginning 1H26) and a win in co- packaged optics for 3Di tools. On track to regain share, at a major 2.5D packaging customer, with revenue contributions expected in 1H26.

TER - Broadly Mgmt. noted improving visibility and better higher utilization driving new system sales vs. upgrades. Highlighted multiple growth opportunities 1) Custom Silicon Ramps + Mkt Share Gain at Merchant Compute. 2) HBM Market Share Wins + TAM Expansion; & 3) IA Win Ramping in 2026.

Please see the analyst certification and important disclosures on page 7 of this report. Evercore ISI and affiliates do and seek to do business with companies covered in its research reports. Investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. © 2025. Evercore Group L.L.C. All rights reserved.

Management emphasized moving beyond "break/fix" to full- service partnerships that deliver ROI for customers, including Alx (Actionable Insight Accelerator) for predictive maintenance, optimizing technology transfers/ramps. With over 7,000 tools connected to 30,000 chambers, Management emphasized the role of predictive analytics and data science in services, enabling advance warnings on potential tool failures and allowing equipment to be restored quickly. Mgmt. highlighted that AMAT's core services grow at a \(10\%\) CAGR, vs. \(6\%\) growth installed base. Average contract length increased from 2.0 to 2.9 years in two years, backlog \(\sim\) \$6.9B, with \(\sim 90\%\) renewal rate

Utilization Stable in ICAPS; High in Leading Edge F&L & Memory. Through AMAT's services offering, AMAT has good visibility into tools utilization. Mgmt. noted that utilization levels have been stable in ICAPS - but lower than 2022/2023 levels; Leading edge foundry and DRAM for HBM are running at high utilization levels.

China. Expect to see digestion in China after heavy investments in 2023 and 2024. Mgmt expects China exposure to normalize at \(\sim 20 - 25\%\) of revs. Mgmt. acknowledged growing competition from local China suppliers and highlighted that AMAT typically benefits from the first build and follow up builds are shifting to local suppliers. AMAT's service & innovation on ICAPS product helps with a differentiate vs. competitors.
DRAM: Expect near- record revenues in 2025, as advanced DRAM demand outside China offsets restrictions. Multi- year HBM packaging investment underway (hybrid bonding, glass panels).
NAND: Lower share base for AMAT; modest benefits from multinational demand, but long- term DC use cases could improve trajectory.

Leading- Edge Foundry & Logic (F&L): Strong position in GAA and BSP nodes. Total opportunity grows from \(\) 12B\((\text{FinFET})\) to \(\) 14B\((\text{GAA + BSP})\) and AMAT expects to see \(>50\%\) share post GAA vs. \(
2026 outlook. Uncertainty due to bifurcation - strong spending by Al beneficiaries vs. weak demand from cyclical segments.

Litho Intensity. In foundry & logic, 2nm nodes are focused on architecture shift to GAA and Backside power. Going forward Mgmt. expects to see transistor scaling to follow as these nodes stabilize. Mgmt. highlighted increase in litho intensity on DRAM even as architecture shifts to 4F2. 3D DRAM likely getting

- 2022: undersupplied industry by \(50\%\) .- 2023-24: shipped heavily, covering prior backlog. Exposure revised to \(\sim 25\%\) .- Historically "Big 4" customers; now "Big 6" as Huawei, SMIC, Huahong, and two logic players scaled up.- Some DRAM-related backlog (\$1.4B) canceled after new export restrictions and removed from \$33B orders.- Still significant need for immersion tools, even at 45nm.- \(\sim 70\%\) of China's value concentrated in top 6 customers.
Leading- edge Spend. TSMC fab build out continues to remain strong. INTC trajectory remain uncertain and Samsung Taylor fab announcement are incrementally positive

2026 Visibility \(\Rightarrow\) Strong Leading - edge F&L + Advanced Packaging. While Mgmt. didn't share growth outlook for 2026, the company noted good demand visibility from leading- edge F&L and Adv packaging customers.
China. Reiterated expectation of China revs to grow QQ in SepQ followed by digestion in DecQ. 2026 China remains a wild card and Mgmt. views normalized China exposure be \(\sim 20\%\) of total revs.

NAND Demand. Mgmt. expects NAND revs to be lumpy Qtr- to- Qtr, but noted high conviction in NAND rev growth, benefiting from \(\sim\) 40bn spend on upgrades for higher layer count conversions over the next several years. LRCX expects to primarily benefit from higher etch intensity with higher layer count conversion assuming "mid- teen" bit growth.

F&L Share Gains. LRCX expects to gain share in F&L markets with for selective etch and ALD tools with transition to GAA and adoption of molybdenum (replacing tungsten) which is driving a 3x expansion for LRCX's metal deposition SAM per wafer vs. non- moly devices.

Advanced Packaging. HBM and F&L AP revs expected to remain strong. Mgmt. highlighted that LRCX's SABRE 3D market share in adv packaging is expected to grow 5pts YY in 2025 layering on top of strong share position on SYNDION tools for TSV application.
Expect to Outgrow WFE in 2026. Overall, Mgmt. expects to outperform WFE benefiting from higher deposition and etch intensity with 3D scaling across F&L and memory market
2026 Outlook. Visibility remains limited given the 3- to- 6 months of lead time on CAMT's advanced packaging tools

HBM - Multi- Year Growth Opportunity. Management sees HBM as a sustained, multi- year growth driver, underpinned by: 1) rising HBM capacity per accelerator; 2) increasing stack heights from 8- high to 12- and eventually 16- high; 3) larger die sizes to support higher memory density and TSV integration; and 4) greater interconnect complexity with denser TSV and microbump requirements.

Tech Transitions in HBM, CoWoS = Eagle G5 & Hawk Ramp. Mgmt noted that the transitions from CoWoS- S to CoWoS- L; HBM3E to HBM4; and Hybrid bonding (2027 onwards) will require a completely different level of tools which will drive a strong refresh cycle via its Eagle G5 and Hawk tools. Eagle G5 and Hawk systems are expected to generate \(\sim 30\%\) of revs in 2025, with a potential to increase to \(\sim 50\%\) in 2026.
China. Mgmt. does not see evidence of digestion or demand decline in China

Prioritizing GM Improvement. Mgmt. highlighted that the company is undertaking initiatives to drive operating cost reductions, which coupled with a more favorable product mix, mainly a larger contribution from and the foundry and logic market, would drive GM back to target level of \(47\%\) . Mgmt. highlighted plans to shift manufacturing to low cost region with the acquisition of manufacturing facility in Farmers Branch, Texas,
Emerging CPO Tailwinds. Mgmt. noted it has multiple systems running in pilot production and expects the CPO systems to be ready for high volume production in 1H26.

HBM Revs to Grow in 2025. Mgmt. reiterated expectations for HBM revenues to grow in 2025 on YY basis driven by 1) current HBM3E designs, 2) increasing HBM4 shipments expected to ramp in 2H25, and 3) growing contribution from FORM's 2nd DRAM customer.
Strategic Priority to Diversify Customer Base. FORM is in the qualification process to expand market position with new customer qualifications in client PC and server applications, and AI GPUs.

China. Mgmt. does not see evidence of digestion or demand decline, and noted stable utilization levels of tools and backlog visibility extending to \(>6\) months GAA Ramps. Continue to expect step function increase in GAA revs ramps in 2025 and reiterated \(\) 500M\(revenue potential by 2026, supported by TSMC, Intel, Samsung, and Rapidus. TSMC continues to invest steadily, while Samsung is regaining traction. NVMI hasn't seen lumpiness in leading - edge spending. Advanced Packaging. Advanced packaging revs remain strong capturing \~15% of revs as NVMI penetrates back - end with chemical metrology and dimensional tools

Product Cycle over the next 2- 3 years will be led by 1) growing penetration of Dimensional metrology (40- 50% of revenues), driven by PRISM technology; 2) Adoption of Material metrology (30- 40%) with tools like VERAFLEX, METRION, and ELIPSON, and 3) Adoption chemical metrology ( \(\sim 10\%\) ) in back- end as well as front- end. NVMI also announced new WMC optical metrology platform for applications in advanced packaging

HBM. Mgmt. reiterated expectation of \(40\%\) decline in HBM revs in 2025 as HBM customers digest capacity. HBM4 expected to increase the process control/ inspection requirements but visibility on capacity increases in 2026 remains limited.

Path to Regain Share in AP. Mgmt. highlighted that 2.5D logic packaging customer successfully validated the performance of next gen Dragonfly platform for high resolution applications in AP - and expects rev contributions in 1H26.

Adoption of Adv packages in Smartphones. Management highlighted that the next wave of growth in advanced packaging will be driven by the adoption of wafer- level multi- chip modules (WMCM) into smartphones. They expect these programs to begin contributing to revenue in the first half of 2026 Co- packaged Optics. Mgmt. highlighted a win in co- packaged optics for 3Di tools.
Advanced Node Recovery Led by GAA Ramps. Mgmt. highlighted strong share position across all leading- edge F&L customers. Mgmt. expect GAA ramps to remain strong going into 2026.
China. China revs expected to remain small \(\sim 5 - 7\%\) of total revs.
Broadly Mgmt. noted improving visibility and better higher utilization driving new system sales vs. upgrades.

Custom Silicon Ramps Starting 2H25 + Potential to Gain Mkt Share at Merchant Compute Supplier. Mgmt. expects strong growth in SOC revs in 2H25 and 2026 as multiple custom silicon programs start ramping. In addition to the custom silicon and networking growth in compute, Mgmt. noted potential opportunity to gain market share in merchant compute silicon which captures majority of the compute TAM today

HBM Market Share Wins + TAM Expansion with New Test Insertion. Mgmt. expects memory test revs to "snap- back" in 2H25 driven by 1) HBM4 performance test win with a new DRAM manufacturer (announced in 1Q25) which is expected to begin shipments in 2H25; and 2) Addition of new step to test HBM singulated stacks (won in 2Q25). Mgmt. noted potential memory TAM expansion if this new test step is adopted across the broader industry.

Industrial Automation Win Ramping in 2026. While IA revs are expected to be below break even levels of \(\sim\) 365mn in 2025, Mgmt said it won a plan of record decision from a large customer which is expected to be a significant growth driver in 2H26.

Time of dissemination: August 28 2025 4:00 AM ET

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:

Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. In Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances. Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
